backup.description: If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup) variable by this module.

virt.description: Manages virtual machines supported by I(libvirt).

xml.description: XML document used with the define command

state.description:
Default: no

Note that there may be some lag for state requests like C(shutdown) since these refer only to VM states. After starting a guest, it may not be immediately accessible.

command.description: in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples

name.description: name of the guest VM being managed. Note that VM must be previously defined with xml.

nxos_ping.description: Tests reachability using ping from switch to a remote destination.

dest.description: IP address or hostname (resolvable by switch) of remote node.

count.description:
Default: 2

Number of packets to send.

pagerduty_alert.description: This module will let you trigger, acknowledge or resolve a PagerDuty incident by sending events

client_url.description: The URL of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.

name.description: PagerDuty unique subdomain.

state.description: Type of event to be sent.

incident_key.description:
Identifies the incident to which this I(state) should be applied.
For C(triggered) I(state) - If there's no open (i.e. unresolved) incident with this key, a new one will be created. If there's already an open incident with a matching key, this event will be appended to that incident's log. The event key provides an easy way to "de-dup" problem reports.
For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - This should be the incident_key you received back when the incident was first opened by a trigger event. Acknowledge events referencing resolved or nonexistent incidents will be discarded.

client.description: The name of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.

service_key.description:
The GUID of one of your "Generic API" services.
This is the "service key" listed on a Generic API's service detail page.

api_key.description: The pagerduty API key (readonly access), generated on the pagerduty site.

desc.description:
Default: Created via Ansible

For C(triggered) I(state) - Required. Short description of the problem that led to this trigger. This field (or a truncated version) will be used when generating phone calls, SMS messages and alert emails. It will also appear on the incidents tables in the PagerDuty UI. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - Text that will appear in the incident's log associated with this event.

github_key.description: Creates, removes, or updates GitHub access keys.

force.description:
Default: yes

The default is C(yes), which will replace the existing remote key if it's different than C(pubkey). If C(no), the key will only be set if no key with the given C(name) exists.

token.description: GitHub Access Token with permission to list and create public keys.

pubkey.description:
Default: none

SSH public key value. Required when C(state=present).

name.description: SSH key name

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to remove a key, ensure that it exists, or update its value.

cs_template.description: Register a template from URL, create a template from a ROOT volume of a stopped VM or its snapshot, extract and delete templates.

is_featured.description:
Register the template to be featured.
Only used if C(state) is present.

vm.description:
VM name the template will be created from its volume or alternatively from a snapshot.
VM must be in stopped state if created from its volume.
Mutually exclusive with C(url).

domain.description: Domain the template, snapshot or VM is related to.

is_extractable.description: True if the template or its derivatives are extractable.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

password_enabled.description: True if the template supports the password reset feature.

zone.description:
Name of the zone you wish the template to be registered or deleted from.
If not specified, first found zone will be used.

sshkey_enabled.description: True if the template supports the sshkey upload feature.

is_dynamically_scalable.description:
Register the template having XS/VMWare tools installed in order to support dynamic scaling of VM CPU/memory.
Only used if C(state) is present.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the template.

template_filter.description:
Default: self

Name of the filter used to search for the template.

is_ready.description:
This flag is used for searching existing templates.
If set to C(true), it will only list template ready for deployment e.g. successfully downloaded and installed.
Recommended to set it to C(false).

is_routing.description:
True if the template type is routing i.e., if template is used to deploy router.
Only considered if C(url) is used.

format.description:
The format for the template.
Relevant when using C(state=present).

is_public.description:
Register the template to be publicly available to all users.
Only used if C(state) is present.

requires_hvm.description: true if this template requires HVM.

account.description: Account the template, snapshot or VM is related to.

name.description: Name of the template.

url.description:
URL of where the template is hosted on C(state=present).
URL to which the template would be extracted on C(state=extracted).
Mutually exclusive with C(vm).

checksum.description:
The MD5 checksum value of this template.
If set, we search by checksum instead of name.

cross_zones.description:
Whether the template should be synced or removed across zones.
Only used if C(state) is present or absent.

project.description: Name of the project the template to be registered in.

snapshot.description:
Name of the snapshot, created from the VM ROOT volume, the template will be created from.
C(vm) is required together with this argument.

mode.description:
Default: http_download

Mode for the template extraction.
Only used if C(state=extracted).

hypervisor.description:
Name the hypervisor to be used for creating the new template.
Relevant when using C(state=present).

os_type.description: OS type that best represents the OS of this template.

profitbricks_volume_attachments.description: Allows you to attach or detach a volume from a ProfitBricks server. This module has a dependency on profitbricks >= 1.0.0

datacenter.description: The datacenter in which to operate.

subscription_user.description: The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environement variable.

server.description: The name of the server you wish to detach or attach the volume.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 600

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

subscription_password.description: THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environement variable.

wait.description:
Default: yes

wait for the operation to complete before returning

os_auth.description: Retrieve an auth token from an OpenStack Cloud

mongodb_parameter.description: Change an administrative parameter on a MongoDB server.

login_port.description:
Default: 27017

The port to connect to

database.description: The name of the database to add/remove the user from

login_user.description: The username used to authenticate with

login_host.description:
Default: localhost

The host running the database

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with

ssl.description: Whether to use an SSL connection when connecting to the database

param_type.description:
Default: str

Define the parameter value (str, int)

value.description: MongoDB administrative parameter value to set

login_database.description: The database where login credentials are stored

replica_set.description: Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)

rollbar_deployment.description: Notify Rollbar about app deployments (see https://rollbar.com/docs/deploys_other/)

comment.description: Deploy comment (e.g. what is being deployed).

rollbar_user.description: Rollbar username of the user who deployed.

url.description:
Default: https://api.rollbar.com/api/1/deploy/

Optional URL to submit the notification to.

environment.description: Name of the environment being deployed, e.g. 'production'.

user.description: User who deployed.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

win_stat.description: Returns information about a Windows file

path.description: The full path of the file/object to get the facts of; both forward and back slashes are accepted.

get_md5.description:
Default: True

Whether to return the checksum sum of the file. As of Ansible 1.9 this is no longer a MD5, but a SHA1 instead.

get_checksum.description:
Default: True

Whether to return a checksum of the file (only sha1 currently supported)

chdir.description: cd into this directory before running make

params.description:
Default: none

Any extra parameters to pass to make

target.description:
Default: none

The target to run

profitbricks_datacenter.description: This is a simple module that supports creating or removing vDCs. A vDC is required before you can create servers. This module has a dependency on profitbricks >= 1.0.0

name.description: The name of the virtual datacenter.

subscription_user.description: The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environement variable.

description.description: The description of the virtual datacenter.

subscription_password.description: THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environement variable.

state.description:
Default: present

create or terminate datacenters

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 600

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

location.description:
Default: us/las

The datacenter location.

wait.description:
Default: yes

wait for the datacenter to be created before returning

sparse.description:
Default: True

Enable/disable sparse-mode on the interface.

jp_type_in.description: Type of policy mapped to C(jp_policy_in).

neighbor_type.description: Type of policy mapped to neighbor_policy.

state.description:
Default: present

Manages desired state of the resource.

neighbor_policy.description: Configures a neighbor policy for filtering adjacencies.

hello_interval.description: Hello interval in milliseconds for this interface.

interface.description: Full name of the interface such as Ethernet1/33.

hello_auth_key.description: Authentication for hellos on this interface.

border.description: Configures interface to be a boundary of a PIM domain.

jp_type_out.description: Type of policy mapped to C(jp_policy_out).

network_policy.description: Network policy specifies layer 2 security settings for a portgroup such as promiscuous mode, where guest adapter listens to all the packets, MAC address changes and forged transmits. Settings are promiscuous_mode, forged_transmits, mac_changes

vlan_id.description: VLAN ID to assign to portgroup

azure_rm_networkinterface_facts.description: Get facts for a specific network interface or all network interfaces within a resource group.

name.description: Only show results for a specific network interface.

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group containing the network interface(s). Required when searching by name.

tags.description: Limit results by providing a list of tags. Format tags as 'key' or 'key:value'.

startup_query_interval.description: Query interval used when the IGMP process starts up. The range is from 1 to 18000. The default is 31.

report_llg.description: Configures report-link-local-groups. Enables sending reports for groups in 224.0.0.0/24. Reports are always sent for nonlink local groups. By default, reports are not sent for link local groups.

last_member_qrt.description: Sets the query interval waited after sending membership reports before the software deletes the group state. Values can range from 1 to 25 seconds. The default is 1 second.

group_timeout.description: Sets the group membership timeout for IGMPv2. Values can range from 3 to 65,535 seconds. The default is 260 seconds.

robustness.description: Sets the robustness variable. Values can range from 1 to 7. The default is 2.

startup_query_count.description: Query count used when the IGMP process starts up. The range is from 1 to 10. The default is 2.

oif_routemap.description: Configure a routemap for static outgoing interface (OIF).

immediate_leave.description: Enables the device to remove the group entry from the multicast routing table immediately upon receiving a leave message for the group. Use this command to minimize the leave latency of IGMPv2 group memberships on a given IGMP interface because the device does not send group-specific queries. The default is disabled.

oif_source.description: Configure a source for static outgoing interface (OIF).

state.description:
Default: present

Manages desired state of the resource.

version.description: IGMP version. It can be 2 or 3.

oif_prefix.description: Configure a prefix for static outgoing interface (OIF).

interface.description: The full interface name for IGMP configuration. e.g. I(Ethernet1/2).

querier_timeout.description: Sets the querier timeout that the software uses when deciding to take over as the querier. Values can range from 1 to 65535 seconds. The default is 255 seconds.

last_member_query_count.description: Sets the number of times that the software sends an IGMP query in response to a host leave message. Values can range from 1 to 5. The default is 2.

query_interval.description: Sets the frequency at which the software sends IGMP host query messages. Values can range from 1 to 18000 seconds. he default is 125 seconds.

query_mrt.description: Sets the response time advertised in IGMP queries. Values can range from 1 to 25 seconds. The default is 10 seconds.

clc_group.description: Create or delete Server Groups at Centurylink Centurylink Cloud

description.description: A description of the Server Group

parent.description: The parent group of the server group. If parent is not provided, it creates the group at top level.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create or delete the group

location.description: Datacenter to create the group in. If location is not provided, the group gets created in the default datacenter associated with the account

wait.description:
Default: True

Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

name.description: The name of the Server Group

udm_dns_record.description: This module allows to manage dns records on a univention corporate server (UCS). It uses the python API of the UCS to create a new object or edit it.

data.description: Additional data for this record, e.g. ['a': '192.0.2.1']. Required if C(state=present).

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the dns record is present or not.

type.description: Define the record type. C(host_record) is a A or AAAA record, C(alias) is a CNAME, C(ptr_record) is a PTR record, C(srv_record) is a SRV record and C(txt_record) is a TXT record.

name.description: Name of the record, this is also the DNS record. E.g. www for www.example.com.

zone.description: Corresponding DNS zone for this record, e.g. example.com.

azure_rm_securitygroup_facts.description: Get facts for a specific security group or all security groups within a resource group.

name.description: Only show results for a specific security group.

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group to use.

tags.description: Limit results by providing a list of tags. Format tags as 'key' or 'key:value'.

user.description: Manage user accounts and user attributes.

comment.description: Optionally sets the description (aka I(GECOS)) of user account.

ssh_key_bits.description:
Default: default set by ssh-keygen

Optionally specify number of bits in SSH key to create.

update_password.description:
Default: always

C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

non_unique.description:
Default: no

Optionally when used with the -u option, this option allows to change the user ID to a non-unique value.

force.description:
Default: no

When used with C(state=absent), behavior is as with C(userdel --force).

ssh_key_type.description:
Default: rsa

Optionally specify the type of SSH key to generate. Available SSH key types will depend on implementation present on target host.

ssh_key_passphrase.description: Set a passphrase for the SSH key.  If no passphrase is provided, the SSH key will default to having no passphrase.

home.description: Optionally set the user's home directory.

skeleton.description: Optionally set a home skeleton directory. Requires createhome option!

append.description:
Default: no

If C(yes), will only add groups, not set them to just the list in I(groups).

uid.description: Optionally sets the I(UID) of the user.

ssh_key_comment.description:
Default: ansible-generated on $HOSTNAME

Optionally define the comment for the SSH key.

group.description: Optionally sets the user's primary group (takes a group name).

system.description:
Default: no

When creating an account, setting this to C(yes) makes the user a system account.  This setting cannot be changed on existing users.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the account should exist or not, taking action if the state is different from what is stated.

expires.description:
Default: None

An expiry time for the user in epoch, it will be ignored on platforms that do not support this. Currently supported on Linux and FreeBSD.

ssh_key_file.description:
Default: .ssh/id_rsa

Optionally specify the SSH key filename. If this is a relative filename then it will be relative to the user's home directory.

user.description: Name of the user to create, remove or modify.

groups.description: Puts the user in this comma-delimited list of groups. When set to the empty string ('groups='), the user is removed from all groups except the primary group.

move_home.description:
Default: no

If set to C(yes) when used with C(home=), attempt to move the user's home directory to the specified directory if it isn't there already.

password.description: Optionally set the user's password to this crypted value.  See the user example in the github examples directory for what this looks like in a playbook. See U(http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/faq.html#how-do-i-generate-crypted-passwords-for-the-user-module) for details on various ways to generate these password values. Note on Darwin system, this value has to be cleartext. Beware of security issues.

seuser.description: Optionally sets the seuser type (user_u) on selinux enabled systems.

name.description: Name of the user to create, remove or modify.

createhome.description:
Default: yes

Unless set to C(no), a home directory will be made for the user when the account is created or if the home directory does not exist.

remove.description:
Default: no

When used with C(state=absent), behavior is as with C(userdel --remove).

login_class.description: Optionally sets the user's login class for FreeBSD, OpenBSD and NetBSD systems.

generate_ssh_key.description:
Default: no

Whether to generate a SSH key for the user in question. This will B(not) overwrite an existing SSH key.

quantum_router_gateway.description: Creates/Removes a gateway interface from the router, used to associate a external network with a router to route external traffic.

region_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the region

network_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the external network which should be attached to the router.

login_tenant_name.description:
Default: yes

The tenant name of the login user

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

auth_url.description:
Default: http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/

The keystone URL for authentication

login_password.description:
Default: yes

Password of login user

login_username.description:
Default: admin

login username to authenticate to keystone

router_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the router to which the gateway should be attached.

rax_dns.description: Manage domains on Rackspace Cloud DNS

comment.description: Brief description of the domain. Maximum length of 160 characters

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

ttl.description:
Default: 3600

Time to live of domain in seconds

email.description: Email address of the domain administrator

name.description: Domain name to create

pn_vrouterif.description:
Execute vrouter-interface-add, vrouter-interface-remove, vrouter-interface-modify command.
You configure interfaces to vRouter services on a fabric, cluster, standalone switch or virtual network(VNET).

pn_nic_enable.description: Specify if the NIC is enabled or not

pn_clipassword.description: Provide login password if user is not root.

pn_exclusive.description: Specify if the interface is exclusive to the configuration. Exclusive means that other configurations cannot use the interface. Exclusive is specified when you configure the interface as span interface and allows higher throughput through the interface.

pn_nic_str.description: Specify the type of NIC. Used for vrouter-interface remove/modify.

pn_vrouter_name.description: Specify the name of the vRouter interface.

pn_vrrp_adv_int.description: Specify a VRRP advertisement interval in milliseconds. The range is from 30 to 40950 with a default value of 1000.

pn_vrrp_priority.description: Specify the priority for the VRRP interface. This is a value between 1 (lowest) and 255 (highest).

pn_alias.description: Specify an alias for the interface.

pn_secondary_macs.description: Specify a secondary MAC address for the interface.

pn_cliusername.description: Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_interface_ip.description: Specify the IP address of the interface in x.x.x.x/n format.

state.description: State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add vrouter interface, 'absent' to remove vrouter interface and 'update' to modify vrouter interface.

pn_vrrp_id.description: Specify the ID for the VRRP interface. The IDs on both vRouters must be the same IS number.

pn_vlan.description: Specify the VLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 4092.

pn_interface.description: Specify if the interface is management, data or span interface.

pn_l3port.description: Specify a Layer 3 port for the interface.

pn_vxlan.description: Specify the VXLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 16777215.

pn_cliswitch.description: Target switch to run the cli on.

pn_assignment.description: Specify the DHCP method for IP address assignment.

state.description:
Default: present

Manage the state of the resource

webfaction_site.description: Add or remove a website on a Webfaction host.  Further documentation at http://github.com/quentinsf/ansible-webfaction.

name.description: The name of the website

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the website should exist

subdomains.description: A list of subdomains associated with this site.

host.description: The webfaction host on which the site should be created.

https.description:
Default: false

Whether or not to use HTTPS

login_password.description: The webfaction password to use

site_apps.description: A mapping of URLs to apps

uri.description: Interacts with HTTP and HTTPS web services and supports Digest, Basic and WSSE HTTP authentication mechanisms.

body.description: The body of the http request/response to the web service. If C(body_format) is set to 'json' it will take an already formatted JSON string or convert a data structure into JSON.

status_code.description:
Default: 200

A valid, numeric, HTTP status code that signifies success of the request. Can also be comma separated list of status codes.

headers.description: Add custom HTTP headers to a request in the format of a YAML hash

dest.description: path of where to download the file to (if desired). If I(dest) is a directory, the basename of the file on the remote server will be used.

follow_redirects.description:
Default: safe

Whether or not the URI module should follow redirects. C(all) will follow all redirects. C(safe) will follow only "safe" redirects, where "safe" means that the client is only doing a GET or HEAD on the URI to which it is being redirected. C(none) will not follow any redirects. Note that C(yes) and C(no) choices are accepted for backwards compatibility, where C(yes) is the equivalent of C(all) and C(no) is the equivalent of C(safe). C(yes) and C(no) are deprecated and will be removed in some future version of Ansible.

force_basic_auth.description:
Default: no

The library used by the uri module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.

removes.description: a filename, when it does not exist, this step will not be run.

method.description:
Default: GET

The HTTP method of the request or response. It MUST be uppercase.

creates.description: a filename, when it already exists, this step will not be run.

url.description: HTTP or HTTPS URL in the form (http|https)://host.domain[:port]/path

user.description: username for the module to use for Digest, Basic or WSSE authentication.

timeout.description:
Default: 30

The socket level timeout in seconds

others.description: all arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here

body_format.description:
Default: raw

The serialization format of the body. When set to json, encodes the body argument, if needed, and automatically sets the Content-Type header accordingly.

return_content.description:
Default: no

Whether or not to return the body of the request as a "content" key in the dictionary result. If the reported Content-type is "application/json", then the JSON is additionally loaded into a key called C(json) in the dictionary results.

password.description: password for the module to use for Digest, Basic or WSSE authentication.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.  Prior to 1.9.2 the code defaulted to C(no).

HEADER_.description: Any parameter starting with "HEADER_" is a sent with your request as a header. For example, HEADER_Content-Type="application/json" would send the header "Content-Type" along with your request with a value of "application/json". This option is deprecated as of C(2.1) and may be removed in a future release. Use I(headers) instead.

debconf.description: Configure a .deb package using debconf-set-selections. Or just query existing selections.

name.description: Name of package to configure.

value.description: Value to set the configuration to

vtype.description:
The type of the value supplied.
C(seen) was added in 2.2.

unseen.description: Do not set 'seen' flag when pre-seeding

answer.description: Value to set the configuration to

bigip_node.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM nodes via iControl SOAP API

ip.description: Node IP. Required when state=present and node does not exist. Error when state=absent.

session_state.description: Set new session availability status for node

name.description: Node name

monitor_state.description: Set monitor availability status for node

description.description: Node description.

host.description: Node IP. Required when state=present and node does not exist. Error when state=absent.

monitors.description: Monitor template name list. Always use the full path to the monitor.

state.description:
Default: present

Pool member state

address.description: Node IP. Required when state=present and node does not exist. Error when state=absent.

quorum.description: Monitor quorum value when monitor_type is m_of_n

maven_artifact.description:
Downloads an artifact from a maven repository given the maven coordinates provided to the module. Can retrieve
snapshots or release versions of the artifact and will resolve the latest available version if one is not
available.

username.description: The username to authenticate as to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret key of the repository is hosted on S3

aws_secret_key.description: The username to authenticate as to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret key of the repository is hosted on S3

password.description: The password to authenticate with to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret access key of the repository is hosted on S3

extension.description:
Default: jar

The maven type/extension coordinate

dest.description: The path where the artifact should be written to

state.description:
Default: present

The desired state of the artifact

version.description:
Default: latest

The maven version coordinate

aws_secret_access_key.description: The password to authenticate with to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret access key of the repository is hosted on S3

repository_url.description:
Default: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2

The URL of the Maven Repository to download from.
Use s3://... if the repository is hosted on Amazon S3, added in version 2.2.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to C(no) when no other option exists.

pkg5.description: IPS packages are the native packages in Solaris 11 and higher.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to install (I(present), I(latest)), or remove (I(absent)) a package.

name.description:
An FRMI of the package(s) to be installed/removed/updated.
Multiple packages may be specified, separated by C(,).

web_index.description: Sets an object to be presented as the HTTP index page when accessed by the CDN URL

container.description: The container to use for container or metadata operations.

region.description:
Default: DFW

Region to create an instance in

private.description: Used to set a container as private, removing it from the CDN.  B(Warning!) Private containers, if previously made public, can have live objects available until the TTL on cached objects expires

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

clear_meta.description:
Default: no

Optionally clear existing metadata when applying metadata to existing containers. Selecting this option is only appropriate when setting type=meta

meta.description: A hash of items to set as metadata values on a container

ttl.description: In seconds, set a container-wide TTL for all objects cached on CDN edge nodes. Setting a TTL is only appropriate for containers that are public

web_error.description: Sets an object to be presented as the HTTP error page when accessed by the CDN URL

type.description:
Default: file

Type of object to do work on, i.e. metadata object or a container object

public.description: Used to set a container as public, available via the Cloud Files CDN

netapp_e_snapshot_images.description:
Create and delete snapshots images on snapshot groups for NetApp E-series storage arrays.
Only the oldest snapshot image can be deleted so consistency is preserved.
Related: Snapshot volumes are created from snapshot images.

api_url.description: The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

api_password.description: The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

state.description: Whether a new snapshot image should be created or oldest be deleted.

snapshot_group.description: The name of the snapshot group in which you want to create a snapshot image.

api_username.description: The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

Should https certificates be validated?

resizefs.description:
Default: no

If yes, if the block device and filessytem size differ, grow the filesystem into the space. Note, XFS Will only grow if mounted.

force.description:
Default: no

If yes, allows to create new filesystem on devices that already has filesystem.

opts.description: List of options to be passed to mkfs command.

fstype.description:
File System type to be created.
reiserfs support was added in 2.2.

docker.description:
This is the original Ansible module for managing the Docker container life cycle.
NOTE: Additional and newer modules are available. For the latest on orchestrating containers with Ansible visit our Getting Started with Docker Guide at https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/docsite/rst/guide_docker.rst.

publish_all_ports.description: Publish all exposed ports to the host interfaces.

tty.description: Allocate a pseudo-tty within the container.

cap_add.description: Add capabilities for the container. Requires docker-py >= 0.5.0.

insecure_registry.description: Use insecure private registry by HTTP instead of HTTPS. Needed for docker-py >= 0.5.0.

links.description:
List of other containers to link within this container with an optional
alias. Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(redis:myredis).

docker_user.description: Username or UID to use within the container

lxc_conf.description: LXC configuration parameters, such as C(lxc.aa_profile:unconfined).

image.description: Container image used to match and launch containers.

labels.description: Set container labels. Requires docker >= 1.6 and docker-py >= 1.2.0.

pid.description:
Default: None

Set the PID namespace mode for the container (currently only supports 'host'). Requires docker-py >= 1.0.0 and docker >= 1.5.0

docker_api_version.description:
Default: docker-py default remote API version

Remote API version to use. This defaults to the current default as specified by docker-py.

stop_timeout.description:
Default: 10

How many seconds to wait for the container to stop before killing it.

tls_client_key.description:
Default: ${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/key.pem

Path to the PEM-encoded key used to authenticate docker client. If specified tls_client_cert must be valid

env_file.description: Pass in a path to a file with environment variable (FOO=BAR). If a key value is present in both explicitly presented (i.e. as 'env') and in the environment file, the explicit value will override. Requires docker-py >= 1.4.0.

read_only.description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read only

tls_ca_cert.description:
Default: ${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/ca.pem

Path to a PEM-encoded certificate authority to secure the Docker connection. This has no effect if use_tls is encrypt.

timeout.description:
Default: 60

Docker daemon response timeout in seconds.

detach.description:
Default: True

Enable detached mode to leave the container running in background. If disabled, fail unless the process exits cleanly.

docker_url.description:
Default: ${DOCKER_HOST} or unix://var/run/docker.sock

URL of the host running the docker daemon. This will default to the env var DOCKER_HOST if unspecified.

use_tls.description: Whether to use tls to connect to the docker server.  "no" means not to use tls (and ignore any other tls related parameters). "encrypt" means to use tls to encrypt the connection to the server.  "verify" means to also verify that the server's certificate is valid for the server (this both verifies the certificate against the CA and that the certificate was issued for that host. If this is unspecified, tls will only be used if one of the other tls options require it.

state.description:
Default: started

Assert the container's desired state. "present" only asserts that the matching containers exist. "started" asserts that the matching containers both exist and are running, but takes no action if any configuration has changed. "reloaded" (added in Ansible 1.9) asserts that all matching containers are running and restarts any that have any images or configuration out of date. "restarted" unconditionally restarts (or starts) the matching containers. "stopped" and '"killed" stop and kill all matching containers. "absent" stops and then' removes any matching containers.

tls_client_cert.description:
Default: ${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/cert.pem

Path to the PEM-encoded certificate used to authenticate docker client. If specified tls_client_key must be valid

entrypoint.description: Corresponds to ``--entrypoint`` option of ``docker run`` command and ``ENTRYPOINT`` directive of Dockerfile. Used to match and launch containers.

env.description: Pass a dict of environment variables to the container.

volumes_from.description: List of names of containers to mount volumes from.

net.description:
Network mode for the launched container: bridge, none, container:<name|id>
or host. Requires docker >= 0.11.

privileged.description: Whether the container should run in privileged mode or not.

username.description: Remote API username.

memory_limit.description: RAM allocated to the container as a number of bytes or as a human-readable string like "512MB". Leave as "0" to specify no limit.

extra_hosts.description: Dict of custom host-to-IP mappings to be defined in the container

log_driver.description:
Default: json-file

You can specify a different logging driver for the container than for the daemon. "json-file" Default logging driver for Docker. Writes JSON messages to file. docker logs command is available only for this logging driver. "none" disables any logging for the container. "syslog" Syslog logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to syslog. docker logs command is not available for this logging driver. "journald" Journald logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to "journald". "gelf" Graylog Extended Log Format (GELF) logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to a GELF endpoint likeGraylog or Logstash. "fluentd" Fluentd logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to "fluentd" (forward input). "awslogs" (added in 2.1) Awslogs logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to AWS Cloudwatch Logs. If not defined explicitly, the Docker daemon's default ("json-file") will apply. Requires docker >= 1.6.0.

expose.description: List of additional container ports to expose for port mappings or links. If the port is already exposed using EXPOSE in a Dockerfile, you don't need to expose it again.

stdin_open.description: Keep stdin open after a container is launched.

tls_hostname.description:
Default: Taken from docker_url

A hostname to check matches what's supplied in the docker server's certificate.  If unspecified, the hostname is taken from the docker_url.

registry.description:
Default: DockerHub

Remote registry URL to pull images from.

password.description: Remote API password.

cpu_set.description: CPUs in which to allow execution. Requires docker-py >= 0.6.0.

pull.description:
Default: missing

Control when container images are updated from the C(docker_url) registry. If "missing," images will be pulled only when missing from the host; if '"always," the registry will be checked for a newer version of the image' each time the task executes.

dns.description: List of custom DNS servers for the container.

name.description: Name used to match and uniquely name launched containers. Explicit names are used to uniquely identify a single container or to link among containers. Mutually exclusive with a "count" other than "1".

signal.description:
Default: KILL

With the state "killed", you can alter the signal sent to the container.

log_opt.description: Additional options to pass to the logging driver selected above. See Docker `log-driver <https://docs.docker.com/reference/logging/overview/>` documentation for more information. Requires docker >=1.7.0.

restart_policy.description:
Container restart policy.
The 'unless-stopped' choice is only available starting in Ansible 2.1 and for Docker 1.9 and above.

count.description:
Default: 1

Number of matching containers that should be in the desired state.

devices.description: List of host devices to expose to container

command.description: Command used to match and launch containers.

restart_policy_retry.description: Maximum number of times to restart a container. Leave as "0" for unlimited retries.

volumes.description:
List of volumes to mount within the container
Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(/host:/container[:mode])
You can specify a read mode for the mount with either C(ro) or C(rw). Starting at version 2.1, SELinux hosts can additionally use C(z) or C(Z) mount options to use a shared or private label for the volume.

cap_drop.description: Drop capabilities for the container. Requires docker-py >= 0.5.0.

ports.description: List containing private to public port mapping specification. Use docker 'CLI-style syntax: C(8000), C(9000:8000), or C(0.0.0.0:9000:8000)' where 8000 is a container port, 9000 is a host port, and 0.0.0.0 is - a host interface. The container ports need to be exposed either in the Dockerfile or via the C(expose) option.

ulimits.description: ulimits, list ulimits with name, soft and optionally hard limit separated by colons. e.g. nofile:1024:2048 Requires docker-py >= 1.2.0 and docker >= 1.6.0

pn_vlan.description:
Execute vlan-create or vlan-delete command.
VLANs are used to isolate network traffic at Layer 2.The VLAN identifiers 0 and 4095 are reserved and cannot be used per the IEEE 802.1Q standard. The range of configurable VLAN identifiers is 2 through 4092.

pn_scope.description:
Specify a scope for the VLAN.
Required for vlan-create.

pn_clipassword.description: Provide login password if user is not root.

pn_cliusername.description: Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_vlanid.description: Specify a VLAN identifier for the VLAN. This is a value between 2 and 4092.

state.description: State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vlan and 'absent' to delete vlan.

pn_ports.description: Specifies the switch network data port number, list of ports, or range of ports. Port numbers must ne in the range of 1 to 64.

pn_untagged_ports.description: Specifies the ports that should have untagged packets mapped to the VLAN. Untagged packets are packets that do not contain IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tags.

pn_cliswitch.description: Target switch(es) to run the cli on.

pn_stats.description: Specify if you want to collect statistics for a VLAN. Statistic collection is enabled by default.

pn_description.description: Specify a description for the VLAN.

quantum_floating_ip_associate.description: Associates or disassociates a specific floating IP with a particular instance

region_name.description:
Default: None

name of the region

instance_name.description:
Default: None

name of the instance to which the public IP should be assigned

login_tenant_name.description:
Default: True

the tenant name of the login user

state.description:
Default: present

indicates the desired state of the resource

auth_url.description:
Default: http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/

the keystone url for authentication

login_password.description:
Default: yes

password of login user

login_username.description:
Default: admin

login username to authenticate to keystone

ip_address.description:
Default: None

floating ip that should be assigned to the instance

azure_rm_subnet.description: Create, update or delete a subnet within a given virtual network. Allows setting and updating the address prefix CIDR, which must be valid within the context of the virtual network. Use the azure_rm_networkinterface module to associate interfaces with the subnet and assign specific IP addresses.

name.description: Name of the subnet.

virtual_network_name.description: Name of an existing virtual network with which the subnet is or will be associated.

security_group_name.description: Name of an existing security group with which to associate the subnet.

state.description:
Default: present

Assert the state of the subnet. Use 'present' to create or update a subnet and 'absent' to delete a subnet.

address_prefix.description: CIDR defining the IPv4 address space of the subnet. Must be valid within the context of the virtual network.

address_prefix_cidr.description: CIDR defining the IPv4 address space of the subnet. Must be valid within the context of the virtual network.

security_group.description: Name of an existing security group with which to associate the subnet.

virtual_network.description: Name of an existing virtual network with which the subnet is or will be associated.

statusio_maintenance.description:
Creates a maintenance window for status.io
Deletes a maintenance window for status.io

maintenance_notify_72_hr.description: Notify subscribers 72 hours before maintenance start time

maintenance_notify_1_hr.description: Notify subscribers 1 hour before maintenance start time

container.description:
Default: None

The given name of your container (data center)

start_time.description:

Time maintenance is expected to start (Hour:Minutes) (UTC)

Default: None

The given name of your component (server name)

automation.description: Automatically start and end the maintenance window

maintenance_notify_24_hr.description: Notify subscribers 24 hours before maintenance start time

all_infrastructure_affected.description: If it affects all components and containers

django_manage.description: Manages a Django application using the I(manage.py) application frontend to I(django-admin). With the I(virtualenv) parameter, all management commands will be executed by the given I(virtualenv) installation.

virtualenv.description: An optional path to a I(virtualenv) installation to use while running the manage application.

app_path.description: The path to the root of the Django application where B(manage.py) lives.

database.description: The database to target. Used by the 'createcachetable', 'flush', 'loaddata', and 'syncdb' commands.

pythonpath.description: A directory to add to the Python path. Typically used to include the settings module if it is located external to the application directory.

settings.description: The Python path to the application's settings module, such as 'myapp.settings'.

apps.description: A list of space-delimited apps to target. Used by the 'test' command.

cache_table.description: The name of the table used for database-backed caching. Used by the 'createcachetable' command.

merge.description: Will run out-of-order or missing migrations as they are not rollback migrations, you can only use this parameter with 'migrate' command

command.description:
The name of the Django management command to run. Built in commands are cleanup, collectstatic, flush, loaddata, migrate, runfcgi, syncdb, test, and validate.
Other commands can be entered, but will fail if they're unknown to Django.  Other commands that may prompt for user input should be run with the I(--noinput) flag.

skip.description: Will skip over out-of-order missing migrations, you can only use this parameter with I(migrate)

link.description: Will create links to the files instead of copying them, you can only use this parameter with 'collectstatic' command

fixtures.description: A space-delimited list of fixture file names to load in the database. B(Required) by the 'loaddata' command.

failfast.description:
Default: no

Fail the command immediately if a test fails. Used by the 'test' command.

dladm_etherstub.description: Create or delete etherstubs on Solaris/illumos systems.

state.description:
Default: present

Create or delete Solaris/illumos etherstub.

temporary.description: Specifies that the etherstub is temporary. Temporary etherstubs do not persist across reboots.

name.description: Etherstub name.

pn_vrouter.description:
Execute vrouter-create, vrouter-delete, vrouter-modify command.
Each fabric, cluster, standalone switch, or virtual network (VNET) can provide its tenants with a virtual router (vRouter) service that forwards traffic between networks and implements Layer 3 protocols.
C(vrouter-create) creates a new vRouter service.
C(vrouter-delete) deletes a vRouter service.
C(vrouter-modify) modifies a vRouter service.

pn_ospf_redistribute.description: Specify how OSPF routes are redistributed.

pn_name.description: Specify the name of the vRouter.

state.description: State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vrouter, 'absent' to delete vrouter and 'update' to modify vrouter.

pn_clipassword.description: Provide login password if user is not root.

pn_bgp_redistribute.description: Specify how BGP routes are redistributed.

pn_router_type.description:
Specify if the vRouter uses software or hardware.
Note that if you specify hardware as router type, you cannot assign IP addresses using DHCP. You must specify a static IP address.

pn_hw_vrrp_id.description: Specifies the VRRP ID for a hardware vrouter.

pn_vnet.description:
Specify the name of the VNET.
Required for vrouter-create.

pn_cliusername.description: Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_rip_redistribute.description: Specify how RIP routes are redistributed.

pn_bgp_options.description: Specify other BGP options as a whitespaces separated string within single quotes ''.

pn_bgp_max_paths.description: Specify the maximum number of paths for BGP. This is a number between 1 and 255 or 0 to unset.

pn_service_state.description: Specify to enable or disable vRouter service.

pn_service_type.description: Specify if the vRouter is a dedicated or shared VNET service.

pn_cliswitch.description: Target switch(es) to run the CLI on.

pn_ospf_options.description: Specify other OSPF options as a whitespaces separated string within single quotes ''.

pn_bgp_as.description: Specify the Autonomous System Number(ASN) if the vRouter runs Border Gateway Protocol(BGP).

url.description:
Default: https://api.honeybadger.io/v1/deploys

Optional URL to submit the notification to.

repo.description:
Default: None

URL of the project repository

user.description:
Default: None

The username of the person doing the deployment

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

revision.description:
Default: None

A hash, number, tag, or other identifier showing what revision was deployed

ec2_asg.description:
Can create or delete AWS Autoscaling Groups
Works with the ec2_lc module to manage Launch Configurations

default_cooldown.description:
Default: 300 seconds

The number of seconds after a scaling activity completes before another can begin.

health_check_period.description:
Default: 500 seconds

Length of time in seconds after a new EC2 instance comes into service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health.

lc_check.description:
Default: True

Check to make sure instances that are being replaced with replace_instances do not already have the current launch_config.

availability_zones.description: List of availability zone names in which to create the group.  Defaults to all the availability zones in the region if vpc_zone_identifier is not set.

replace_batch_size.description:
Default: 1

Number of instances you'd like to replace at a time.  Used with replace_all_instances.

replace_instances.description:
Default: None

List of instance_ids belonging to the named ASG that you would like to terminate and be replaced with instances matching the current launch configuration.

desired_capacity.description: Desired number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.

state.description:
Default: present

register or deregister the instance

health_check_type.description:
Default: EC2

The service you want the health status from, Amazon EC2 or Elastic Load Balancer.

launch_config_name.description: Name of the Launch configuration to use for the group. See the ec2_lc module for managing these.

tags.description:
Default: None

A list of tags to add to the Auto Scale Group. Optional key is 'propagate_at_launch', which defaults to true.

min_size.description: Minimum number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.

vpc_zone_identifier.description:
Default: None

List of VPC subnets to use

load_balancers.description: List of ELB names to use for the group

max_size.description: Maximum number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.

name.description: Unique name for group to be created or deleted

replace_all_instances.description: In a rolling fashion, replace all instances with an old launch configuration with one from the current launch configuration.

termination_policies.description:
Default: Default

An ordered list of criteria used for selecting instances to be removed from the Auto Scaling group when reducing capacity.
For 'Default', when used to create a new autoscaling group, the "Default"i value is used. When used to change an existent autoscaling group, the current termination policies are maintained.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

how long before wait instances to become viable when replaced.  Used in conjunction with instance_ids option.

notification_topic.description:
Default: None

A SNS topic ARN to send auto scaling notifications to.

notification_types.description:
Default: ['autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH', 'autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH_ERROR', 'autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE', 'autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE_ERROR']

A list of auto scaling events to trigger notifications on.

wait_for_instances.description:
Default: True

Wait for the ASG instances to be in a ready state before exiting.  If instances are behind an ELB, it will wait until the ELB determines all instances have a lifecycle_state of  "InService" and  a health_status of "Healthy".

azure_rm_storageblob.description: Create, update and delete blob containers and blob objects. Use to upload a file and store it as a blob object, or download a blob object to a file.

src.description: Source file path. Use with state 'present' to upload a blob.

container_name.description: Name of a blob container within the storage account.

force.description: Overwrite existing blob or file when uploading or downloading. Force deletion of a container that contains blobs.

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group to use.

dest.description: Destination file path. Use with state 'present' to download a blob.

destination.description: Destination file path. Use with state 'present' to download a blob.

source.description: Source file path. Use with state 'present' to upload a blob.

state.description:
Default: present

Assert the state of a container or blob.
Use state 'absent' with a container value only to delete a container. Include a blob value to remove a specific blob. A container will not be deleted, if it contains blobs. Use the force option to override, deleting the container and all associated blobs.
Use state 'present' to create or update a container and upload or download a blob. If the container does not exist, it will be created. If it exists, it will be updated with configuration options. Provide a blob name and either src or dest to upload or download. Provide a src path to upload and a dest path to download. If a blob (uploading) or a file (downloading) already exists, it will not be overwritten unless the force parameter is true.

container.description: Name of a blob container within the storage account.

blob.description: Name of a blob object within the container.

content_type.description: Set the blob content-type header. For example, 'image/png'.

public_access.description: Determine a container's level of public access. By default containers are private. Can only be set at time of container creation.

content_md5.description: Set the blob md5 hash value.

storage_account_name.description: Name of the storage account to use.

blob_name.description: Name of a blob object within the container.

account_name.description: Name of the storage account to use.

netapp_e_auth.description: Sets or updates the password for a storage array.  When the password is updated on the storage array, it must be updated on the SANtricity Web Services proxy. Note, all storage arrays do not have a Monitor or RO role.

ssid.description: the identifier of the storage array in the Web Services Proxy.

new_password.description: The password you would like to set. Cannot be more than 30 characters.

api_password.description:
The password used to authenticate against the API
This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_PASSWORD

current_password.description: The current admin password. This is not required if the password hasn't been set before.

api_username.description:
The username used to authenticate against the API
This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_USERNAME

api_url.description:
The full API url.
Example: http://ENDPOINT:8080/devmgr/v2
This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_URL

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

Should https certificates be validated?

set_admin.description: Boolean value on whether to update the admin password. If set to false then the RO account is updated.

name.description: The name of the storage array. Note that if more than one storage array with this name is detected, the task will fail and you'll have to use the ID instead.

os_keystone_domain.description: Create, update, or delete OpenStack Identity domains. If a domain with the supplied name already exists, it will be updated with the new description and enabled attributes.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

enabled.description:
Default: True

Is the domain enabled

name.description: Name that has to be given to the instance

description.description:
Default: None

Description of the domain

dynamodb_table.description:
Create or delete AWS Dynamo DB tables.
Can update the provisioned throughput on existing tables.
Returns the status of the specified table.

read_capacity.description:
Default: 1

Read throughput capacity (units) to provision.

hash_key_name.description:
Name of the hash key.
Required when C(state=present).

range_key_type.description:
Default: STRING

Type of the range key.

name.description: Name of the table.

write_capacity.description:
Default: 1

Write throughput capacity (units) to provision.

indexes.description:
list of dictionaries describing indexes to add to the table. global indexes can be updated. local indexes don't support updates or have throughput.
required options: ['name', 'type', 'hash_key_name']
valid types: ['all', 'global_all', 'global_include', 'global_keys_only', 'include', 'keys_only']
other options: ['hash_key_type', 'range_key_name', 'range_key_type', 'includes', 'read_capacity', 'write_capacity']

state.description:
Default: present

Create or delete the table

hash_key_type.description:
Default: STRING

Type of the hash key.

route53.description: Creates and deletes DNS records in Amazons Route53 service

health_check.description: Health check to associate with this record

weight.description: Weighted resource record sets only. Among resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type, a value that determines what portion of traffic for the current resource record set is routed to the associated location.

alias.description: Indicates if this is an alias record.

region.description: Latency-based resource record sets only Among resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type, a value that determines which region this should be associated with for the latency-based routing

retry_interval.description:
Default: 500

In the case that route53 is still servicing a prior request, this module will wait and try again after this many seconds. If you have many domain names, the default of 500 seconds may be too long.

value.description: The new value when creating a DNS record.  Multiple comma-spaced values are allowed for non-alias records.  When deleting a record all values for the record must be specified or Route53 will not delete it.

hosted_zone_id.description: The Hosted Zone ID of the DNS zone to modify

record.description: The full DNS record to create or delete

private_zone.description: If set to true, the private zone matching the requested name within the domain will be used if there are both public and private zones. The default is to use the public zone.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

How long to wait for the changes to be replicated, in seconds.

alias_evaluate_target_health.description: Whether or not to evaluate an alias target health. Useful for aliases to Elastic Load Balancers.

ttl.description:
Default: 3600 (one hour)

The TTL to give the new record

identifier.description: Have to be specified for Weighted, latency-based and failover resource record sets only. An identifier that differentiates among multiple resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type.

vpc_id.description:
When used in conjunction with private_zone: true, this will only modify records in the private hosted zone attached to this VPC.
This allows you to have multiple private hosted zones, all with the same name, attached to different VPCs.

zone.description: The DNS zone to modify

type.description: The type of DNS record to create

failover.description: Failover resource record sets only. Whether this is the primary or secondary resource record set. Allowed values are PRIMARY and SECONDARY

overwrite.description: Whether an existing record should be overwritten on create if values do not match

wait.description: Wait until the changes have been replicated to all Amazon Route 53 DNS servers.
